timeline.message:
Clean up InventoryGUI; add translations to FlySpeedTool

Signed-off-by: applenick <applenick@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: TheMolkaPL
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,18 +16,27 @@
 
 public abstract class InventoryGUI {
 
-  /*
-   * Code extracted from PickerMatchModule to allow for reuse
-   */
-
-  public Set<MatchPlayer> viewing = Sets.newHashSet();
+  protected static int ROW_WIDTH = 9; // Number of columns per row
+  protected static int MAX_ROWS = 6; // Max allowed row size

timeline.bodyText: I think all of these can be final?
timeline.author: TheMolkaPL
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,18 +16,27 @@
 
 public abstract class InventoryGUI {
 
-  /*
-   * Code extracted from PickerMatchModule to allow for reuse
-   */
-
-  public Set<MatchPlayer> viewing = Sets.newHashSet();
+  protected static int ROW_WIDTH = 9; // Number of columns per row
+  protected static int MAX_ROWS = 6; // Max allowed row size
 
-  public String title; // Title of the inventory
-  private int size; // Size of inventory
+  private Set<MatchPlayer> viewing = Sets.newHashSet(); // Set of players who are viewing the gui
+  private String title; // Title of the inventory
+  private int rows; // The # of rows in the inventory

timeline.message:
Make InventoryGUI variables final

Signed-off-by: applenick <applenick@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: We should keep a comment here saying that this command is from WorldEdit and it unstucks the player. Also having worldedit: there would be cool.
timeline.author: TheMolkaPL

timeline.bodyText: I'm sure there is a translation for this in the client for thìs. Can we use it?
timeline.author: TheMolkaPL

replies.bodyText: Curious. I’m not familiar with the client translations, could you explain?
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText:
These are the values in the 1.8.9 en_US.lang file:
gameMode.survival=Survival Mode
gameMode.creative=Creative Mode
gameMode.adventure=Adventure Mode
gameMode.spectator=Spectator Mode

Alternatively:
selectWorld.gameMode.survival=Survival
selectWorld.gameMode.creative=Creative
selectWorld.gameMode.adventure=Adventure
selectWorld.gameMode.spectator=Spectator
replies.author: Meeples10

replies.bodyText:
Thanks @Meeples10!
Ah I understand now, that’s very useful 👍
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText: Have you confirmed that this actually works? I'm not sure if PGM translates vanilla messages.
replies.author: Meeples10

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this command is really needed since the item on the inventory exists.
If the concern is not being able to open the menu if you throw out the diamond, make it so any diamond right-clicking works.
timeline.author: Pablete1234

replies.bodyText:
Hey @Pablete1234,
So what I encountered during testing was the lack of the ability to use any item while a player is in the spectator gamemode. Unless there is some odd method to access items as a spectator which I’m unaware of, I’m unsure how exactly one can return to the menu without using the command.
Here’s a look at what I mean:
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText: @applenick the item you have selected is still the diamond, right-ckicking brings uo the menu again. IIRC, you must click againt block while in gm3 or there's no event
replies.author: Pablete1234
applenick

timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText:
have a:
private static FlySpeed[] speeds = values();
and have this method be:
return speeds[(ordinal() + 1) % speeds.length]

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't seem to get cleaned up anywhere? How about using WeakHashMap ?
timeline.author: Electroid

replies.bodyText:
Hey @Electroid,
The viewing map does get cleaned up via the ObserverToolsMatchModule manually. I switched it over to a WeakHashMap as suggested, to accommodate for when future implementations are added, just so cleanup occurs in case not manually done.
Thanks!
replies.author: applenick

timeline.message:
Use a WeakHashMap in InventoryMenu

Signed-off-by: applenick <applenick@users.noreply.github.com>
